Class: EndpointProvider

rtcomm. EndpointProvider

Provides Services to register a user and create RtcommEndpoints

This programming interface lets a JavaScript client application use a Real Time Communication Endpoint to implement WebRTC simply. When instantiated & initialized the RtcommEndpointProvider connects to the defined MQTT Server and subscribes to a unique topic that is used to receive inbound communication.

See the example in EndpointProvider.init()

new EndpointProvider()

Methods

createRtcommEndpoint(endpointConfig) → {module:rtcomm.RtcommEndpoint|RtcommEndpoint}

createRtcommEndpoint - Factory method that returns a RtcommEndpoint object to be used by a UI component. The rtcommEndpoint object provides an interface for the UI Developer to attach Video and Audio input/output. Essentially mapping a broadcast stream(a MediaStream that is intended to be sent) to a RTCPeerConnection output stream. When an inbound stream is added to a RTCPeerConnection, then the RtcommEndpoint object also informs the RTCPeerConnection where to send that stream in the User Interface.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
endpointConfig module:rtcomm.EndpointProvider~EndpointConfig Configuration to initialize endpoint with.
Source:
  • rtcomm.js, line 2275
Throws:
Error
Returns:
A RtcommEndpoint Object
Type
module:rtcomm.RtcommEndpoint | RtcommEndpoint
Example

var endpointConfig = { 
  audio: true, 
  video: true, 
  data: false, 
  };
rtcommEndpointProvider.createRtcommEndpoint(endpointConfig);

init(config, onSuccessopt, onFailureopt, statusopt)

init method This method is required to be called prior to doing anything else.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
config module:rtcomm.EndpointProvider~InitOptions Configuration object for init
onSuccess function <optional>
 Callback function when init is complete successfully.
onFailure function <optional>
 Callback funtion if a failure occurs during init
status function <optional>
 Callback function to monitor status of init
Source:
  • rtcomm.js, line 2117
Example
var endpointProvider = new ibm.rtcomm.RtcommEndpointProvider(); 
var endpointProviderConfig = {
  server : 'broker.mqttdashboard.com',       
  userid : 'ibmAgent1@mysurance.org',
  connectorTopicName : 'endpointConnector',   
  connectorTopicPath : '/rtcomm/', 
  port : 8000,                          
  register: true,                     
  createEndpoint : true,                   
  credentials : null                  
};

// Initialize the Service. [Using onSuccess/onFailure callbacks]
// This initializes the MQTT layer and enables inbound Communication.
var rtcommEndpoint = null;  
endpointProvider.init(endpointProviderConfig, 
   function(object) { //onSuccess
       console.log('init was successful, rtcommEndpoint: ', object);
       rtcommEndpoint = object;
   },
   function(error) { //onFailure
      console.error('init failed: ', error);
     }
);

register(onSuccessopt, onFailureopt)

Register the 'userid' used in init with the rtcomm service so it can receive inbound requests.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
onSuccess function <optional>
 Called when register completes successfully with the returned message about the userid
onFailure function <optional>
 Callback executed if register fails, argument contains reason.

Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
audio boolean <optional>
 true Support audio in the PeerConnection - defaults to true
video boolean <optional>
 true Support video in the PeerConnection - defaults to true
data boolean <optional>
 true Support data in the PeerConnectio - defaults to true
context String <optional>
 'none' Context for the Handler. Used in messages and with the server. defaults to 'none'

 1883 MQTT Server Port
userid string User ID or Identity
connectorTopicName string <optional>
 endpointConnection connectorTopicName on rtcomm server
connectorTopicPath string <optional>
 /rtcomm/ MQTT Path to prefix connectorTopicName with and register under
register boolean <optional>
 false Automatically register
createEndpoint boolean <optional>
 false Automatically create a RtcommEndpoint
